üìö How Real Biometric Authentication Works

üîê Registration Process

  1. Browser checks for biometric hardware availability
  2. Server generates a unique cryptographic challenge
  3. Your device prompts for Face ID/Touch ID/Windows Hello
  4. Secure enclave creates a public-private key pair
  5. Public key is sent to server (biometric data never leaves device)
  6. Credential is stored for future authentication

üîì Authentication Process

  1. Server sends authentication challenge
  2. Browser requests biometric verification
  3. You authenticate with Face ID/Touch ID/Windows Hello
  4. Device signs the challenge with your private key
  5. Server verifies the signature using your public key
  6. Access granted if signature is valid

üîí Security Features

  • ‚Ä¢ Privacy: Your biometric data never leaves your device
  • ‚Ä¢ Phishing Resistant: Credentials are bound to specific domains
  • ‚Ä¢ Replay Protection: Each authentication uses a unique challenge
  • ‚Ä¢ Device Security: Keys are stored in secure hardware (Secure Enclave/TEE)
  • ‚Ä¢ No Passwords: Eliminates password-related vulnerabilities

This demo uses the WebAuthn API with real biometric hardware on your device.
Supported on iOS (Face ID/Touch ID), Android (Biometric), macOS (Touch ID), and Windows (Hello).
